meanings.definition: The state of being testate, or having a valid will.
meanings.sent1: Her testacy ensured that her wishes were followed after her passing.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer explained the concept of testacy to the family during the reading of the will.
meanings.sent3: At the family gathering, they joked about who would have the most valuable testacy.
meanings.sent4: In the world of legal documents, testacy is like a guiding light for the deceased.
meanings.sent5: The importance of testacy cannot be overstated when it comes to estate planning.

meanings.definition: The condition of dying with a valid will in place.
meanings.sent1: His testacy brought peace of mind to his loved ones knowing his wishes were clear.
meanings.sent2: The probate court confirmed the testacy of the deceased, allowing the will to be executed.
meanings.sent3: The family celebrated the unusual testacy of their eccentric uncle with a toast.
meanings.sent4: In the final moments, his testacy was a beacon of order in the chaos of his passing.
meanings.sent5: The testacy of the wealthy businessman sparked a legal battle among distant relatives.
